Company Information

At Advarra, we are passionate about making a difference in the world of clinical research and advancing human health. With a rich history rooted in ethical review services combined with innovative technology solutions and deep industry expertise, we are at the forefront of industry change. A market leader and pioneer, Advarra breaks the silos that impede clinical research, aligning patients, sites, sponsors, and CROs in a connected ecosystem to accelerate trials.

Company Culture

Our employees are the heart of Advarra. They are the key to our success and the driving force behind our mission and vision. Our values (Patient-Centric, Ethical, Quality Focused, Collaborative) guide our actions and decisions. Knowing the impact of our work on trial participants and patients, we act with urgency and purpose to advance clinical research so that people can live happier, healthier lives.

At Advarra, we seek to foster an inclusive and collaborative environment where everyone is treated with respect and diverse perspectives are embraced. Treating one another, our clients, and clinical trial participants with empathy and care are key tenets of our culture at Advarra; we are committed to creating a workplace where each employee is not only valued but empowered to thrive and make a meaningful impact.

The Application Implementation Specialist is the subject matter expert on Advarra's software applications and workflows for the full suite of clinical research solutions. title: Senior Analyst,  Implementation
company: HSA Bank, a division of Webster Bank, N.A.
description:
At HSA Bank, we’re working toward a world where everyone is empowered to save for a healthy future. Our offerings in the healthcare savings space drive down healthcare costs, increase access, and assist with decision-making for consumers, health plans, partners, and advisors.

Are you ready to join us?

Position Summary

As a Senior Analyst on the Implementation team, you’ll be providing world-class customer service to our Business Partners, Employers, Agents, Brokers, Insurance Carriers, TPAs, employer relationships and channel partners. Using a consultative approach, you will onboard our employers, develop an optimal plan design to meet their business need, create and maintain a formal implementation plan, and deliver on quality execution and employer satisfaction.

Responsibilities
• Lead onboarding process for employers of varying sizes, which includes presenting the options and working with your assigned employers to select the best plan design and product set up to meet their needs, articulate the implications and customer experience of their go forward design, and conduct training on use of the product.
• Demonstrate and present how our CDH products will function within the chosen plan design/configuration.

• Anticipate, address, and develop solutions for concerns or challenges that an employer may face, leverage internal SMEs where needed to drive and deliver on quality execution.
• Manages implementation by developing and maintaining a detailed project plan for each assigned employer, with sign off by the partner at onset, throughout various components and upon completion.
• Engage in process improvement work throughout the year
• Completes file testing for specific file types and owns communication for all file testing throughout the course of the implementation.

Qualifications
• 3+ years’ experience in healthcare operations and/or implementation
• High School Diploma required, bachelor's degree preferred.
• Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
• Experience in project management.
• Strong problem-solving skills.
• Self-starter with a strong sense of ownership
• “No task is too small” attitude, with a passion for service excellence and an eagerness to learn.

Travel to Milwaukee and Sheboygan offices and/or to client site may be required on a limited basis and requires a valid driver's license with a safe driving record.

The estimated salary range for this position is $60,000USD to $65,000USD. Actual salary may vary up or down depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position is eligible for incentive compensation.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: UKG Ready Implementation Consultant II - Remote
description:
HCM Unlocked’s difference is our people. Our strong culture thrives on trusting and empowering our consultants to be autonomous and nimble with their clients. Our goal is to enable clients to obtain the most from their Payroll/HR technology.

The Technical Consultant will be a “client-side” resource to help execute project tasks, testing and validation, and timely completion of project milestones for a successful go-live. This position combines technical ability and HR, Benefits, and Payroll knowledge to implement clients onto their new HCM platform and/or optimize their existing platform using best practices and standardized processes.

The portfolio of work that this role will execute can span the following areas: implementation of a client onto a new platform, optimization or transformation of a client environment on an existing platform, design and execution of technical solutions to resolve client issues, and any other assistance needed to enhance the support of HCM Unlocked clients.

This role requires knowledge of HRIS software platforms such as: ADP WFN, Paylocity, Paycor, Paycom, Paychex, UKG, Kronos, Blue Marble, Rippling, etc. Experience and knowledge related to troubleshooting inbound/outbound integration files, data transformation and data mapping is extremely beneficial.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• 5-8 years’ experience in a high-volume, client-facing, implementation role with vendor or consulting organization
• Serve on implementation project as a “client-side” resource for technical configurations, integrations, testing and validation tasks.
• Manage day-to-day project tasks for a client’s successful payroll transition
• Configure workflows to optimize system buildout
• Creates custom reports and showcase templated reports to deliver the most value during a client implementation or optimization project.
• Deliver custom system training for clients to ensure a high adoption-rate of technology during a client implementation or optimization project.
• Perform analysis of current client processes and identify opportunities within the software that will deliver the greatest value and functionality for the client.
• Partner with client to identify and prioritize their needs.
• Coordinate directly with platform vendor to obtain answers and design solutions for optimization tasks
• Collaborate with leaders, project managers and other consultants to ensure extremely successful client partnerships
• Participate in pre-sales scoping analysis to determine project needs and projected hours.
• Identify and engage in cross-training opportunities to increase skills across many different platforms and domain areas (ie Payroll, Benefits, HR, Custom Reporting, Integrations, Data, etc).
• Assist project managers and team members in creation of detailed input for project plan sections related to technical configurations and/or integrations for clients.
• Contribute to the creation and execution of test scripts and audits related to all technical configurations and/or integrations during all phases of projects such as SIT, UAT, Parallel and Go-live.
• Serve as a liaison between the client, platform vendor and HCM Unlocked data resources to ensure that the client’s data requirements are accurately and completely captured during the design phase and then confirmed to be complete during testing and validation phases.
• Serve as a liaison between platform vendors and HCM Unlocked technical resources to provide oversight and input during design and testing phases of inbound/outbound integrations between vendors.
• Participate in the review of existing client’s technical architecture and landscape and make recommendations for optimizations with the intent to eliminate the possibility of any errors during the end-to-end flow of data.
• Provide Project Manager with formal Signoff of technical configuration work at each critical validation stage gate.
• Collaborate with Project Manager to maintain the Open Issues log and resolve all items related to technical configurations and/or integrations in a timely manner.
• Provide Project Manager with proof of testing and validation of technical configuration and/or integration work.
• Use Microsoft Excel and data validation tools to assist project team to research issues and confirm data accuracy in customer databases
• Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):
• Expert knowledge on multiple modules within one or more one or more of the following: ADP WFN, Paylocity, Paycor, Paycom, Paychex, UKG, Kronos, Blue Marble, Rippling, Ceridian Dayforce, Workday etc. including Implementation of systems, Custom Reporting functionality, and payroll processing knowledge.
• At least 3 years’ experience in a client-facing, implementation role
• Prior experience owning and leading a project
• Experienced in Time & Attendance system configuration, understanding of labor allocation requirements, integration with various time capture systems to payrolls.
• High School Diploma required - Bachelor’s degree preferred, preferably in a computer-related field
• Experience with integrations between third-party systems – such as API, EDI, or batch processing of flat files.
• Ability to utilize QA processes that capture before and after outcomes and satisfy governance and audit requirements.
• Ability to create specific test scripts based upon individual client needs that will ensure 100% validation of all client data and technical configurations during the course of a project.
• Understanding of PII data and governance requirements and ability to maintain confidentiality related to sensitive company and employee information
• Cultivate and grow understanding of the impact of HR-related situations such as new hires, life events, terminations and open enrollments to assist Benefits with ensuring adherence to all regulatory, carrier and client guidelines
• Ability to partner with Benefits team to complete the plan build, testing and successful launch of open enrollment and ongoing maintenance of eligibility within a client’s HRIS/online enrollment platform.
• Understand and execute the process for building, testing and deploying EDI file feeds between the client’s insurance carriers and HRIS system, to include: plan rule setup, extracting employee data, troubleshooting eligibility during the testing phase and regular upkeep of files once the feeds are active (troubleshooting discrepancies)
• Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to listen and effectively verbalize ideas
• Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects while completing deadlines in an organized manner; demonstrated organizational and time management skills
• Strong communication, interpersonal and client relationship skills and ability to remain calm in stressful situations such as customer escalations
• Familiarity, or ability to rapidly learn, teach, and instruct on various HRIS software platforms.
• Proficiency in MS Office suite of products (MS Word, Excel and Power Point) is essential..
• Excellent analytical problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail

title: Hubspot Implementation Specialist

title: HL7/PACS Technical Implementation Specialist I -
description:
Company Description

At Intelerad, we believe the path to answers in healthcare should be clear-whether you are waiting for a diagnosis or trying to expedite one. Our medical imaging solutions streamline the flow of information, simplifying complex processes, maximizing efficiencies, and shining a light on the unknown. We empower physicians to get patients the answers they need faster and improve outcomes for everyone. With more accessible imaging, we are getting patients out of the dark.

Headquartered in Raleigh, NC and Montreal, Intelerad has nearly 800 employees located in offices across four countries. The company empowers nearly 2,000 healthcare organizations around the world with the speed, scalability, and simplicity needed to increase business performance while, most importantly, improving patient outcomes. Intelerad’s modern enterprise solutions have been acknowledged by a Best in KLAS recognition, ranking #1 for PACS Asia/Oceania in the 2021 Best in KLAS: Global Software (Non-US) report.

Job Description

We are seeking an PACS Technical Implementation Specialist (level 1) with HL7 experience who is responsible for providing technical and workflow implementation services for Radiology Healthcare IT solutions. The role will require a range of technical services, including but not limited to, system integration, system configuration, workflow analysis and design, testing and troubleshooting system setups and facilitation and support of system go-lives. Acting as a key customer-facing representative, the Technical Implementation Specialist will ensure that Intelerad solutions are configured, tested, and operational to meet client needs and align with best practices. This role will work closely with Project Management and Applications and Workflow resource and involve collaboration with cross-functional teams, on-site client engagement, training delivery, documentation, troubleshooting, and proactive participation in change management and escalation processes. The goal is to ensure clients realize the full value of our solution at every stage of their journey.

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with clients to assess needs, design Picture Archiving and Communication Systems (PACS) HL7 workflows, and define system configurations that align with clinical and operational goals.
• Provide remote system administration and perform integrating PACS with Health Level 7 (HL7) standards configuration, deployments and upgrades remotely for customers.
• Providing basic support and services to Implementation staff and external customers for HL7 integrations communications, and integrations workflow design, database changes or troubleshooting
• Collaborating with clinicians and IT staff to optimize workflows and ensure that PACS and HL7 interfaces are used effectively to improve patient care.
• Validate solution operability including network connectivity and third-party integrations; troubleshoot and resolve technical and workflow issues both remotely and on-site.
• Working with Project Management to complete system integration and functionality checks
• Deliver training to end users and administrators and create supporting materials to facilitate successful adoption of new workflows and features.
• Guide clients through go-live and post-go-live phases, ensuring smooth transitions and optimal use of Intelerad solutions.
• Participate in technical discussions / calls and provide regular status updates with customers and third-party vendors.
• Document configurations, workflows, and architecture changes in collaboration with project managers.
• Participate in post-implementation reviews and share insights with internal teams to support continuous improvement.
• Provide workflow and product expertise to internal teams, including support, training, and specialist liaison functions.
• Travel is rare but may be required within specified region to support on-site implementations and client engagement.
• Perform other duties as required to support the success of implementation projects and the wider business.

The base pay for this position ranges from $71,250/year to $95,000/year within any geographic market in the USA. Pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Intelerad is a total compensation company. Pay is dependent on the position offered. Bonus and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, retirement, PTO, and/or other benefits.

Qualifications

Employment Prerequisites
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Medical Imaging Sciences or equivalent
• 1-3 years of experience in Healthcare or IT related roles
• Valid government-issued identification • Ability to travel internationally if required
• Eligibility for security related clearance (where required)
• Understanding of HL7/PACS messaging standards and integration capabilities
• Proficiency with Linux command-line interface for system navigation, file management

Desired Competencies
• Knowledge of enterprise level Radiology Healthcare IT solutions
• In-depth understanding of radiology workflows, including modality, PACS, RIS, and clinical processes within imaging departments
• Strong troubleshooting skills across applications, hardware, operating systems, drivers and networking services.
• Basic knowledge of SQL databases (Sybase, PostgreSQL, MS SQL)
• Familiarity with AWS cloud infrastructure and services
• Understanding of API calls and working with data formats such as JSON
• Experience training and mentoring others on radiology concepts
• Strong communication skills and ability to use creative thinking to problem solve complex technical and integration related issues
• Ability to communicate and build rapport with internal management and other company personnel
• Professional presentation and a self-motivated, proactive work ethic

We’re more than a software company—we’re a team united by purpose, driven by innovation, and inspired by impact.

Global Reach, Local Heart

With offices in North America, the UK, and Australia, we bring global collaboration to local healthcare challenges.

title: Child Welfare Center Implementation Specialist
company: Center for Adoption Support and Education
description:
About the Organization:

The Center for Adoption Support and Education (C.A.S.E.) is a national leader in mental health services for the adoption, foster, and kinship care community. We envision a world where every child and family connected to adoption, foster, and kinship care thrives, embracing our individual and collective diversity. We improve the well-being and permanence of children and their families by delivering adoption-competent mental health services, training a national network of professionals, and informing the field through research and advocacy. We work nationally to build the capacity of States, Tribes and territories to create competent systems and service arrays and improve access to those services.

For over 25 years, C.A.S.E. has combined best practices and innovation to provide specialized individual and family therapy, psychiatric services and support groups, education, and training. We have become a local, national, and international resource for adoptive, kinship, and foster families and the professionals who support them. C.A.S.E. set out in 2021 on a new strategic direction to grow our clinical and training programs into our Academy for Elevating Clinical Practice in Permanency. It is an exciting time as we grow our evidenced-based adoption-competent clinical model and our accredited, award-winning training programs nationwide.

C.A.S.E has an annual budget of $14M and a staff of 70+ employees.

About the Position:

The National Center for Adoption Competent Mental Health Services is a federally funded cooperative agreement with the Department of Health and Human Services, Administration for Children and Families, Children’s Bureau to work with national leaders as well as parents and young adults with lived experience to deliver new and enhanced support, technical assistance (TA), and training to states, tribes, territories, professional and peer support professional to meet the needs of children and families.

The Center Child Welfare Implementation Specialist (CW-CIS) reports to the Director of Technical Assistance of the National Center for Adoption Competent Mental Health Services at C.A.S.E. The CW-CIS works closely with the National Center Leadership team, The Baker Center Implementation team (one of the collaborating partners), the National Adoption Competency Mental Health Training Initiative (NTI) Team (also at C.A.S.E.), and child welfare and mental health leadership in assigned states, tribes, and territories to help sites develop sustainable collaborative structures between child welfare and mental health systems and expand access to adoption competent mental health providers. The full-time CW-CIS will support priming, promotion, implementation, and integration/sustainability of assigned technical assistance (TA) goals and plans. The CW-CIS also provides a range of training, webinars, consultations, and group facilitation to support the overall goals of the Center. CW-CIS is home-based and works remotely.

NOTE: The position requires national travel to assigned agencies and conference locations, with travel expenses reimbursed in accordance with the project grant. National travel will be an expectation of this role. Typically, travel is expected to be once a month for 2-3 days. There may be times when additional travel is requested.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Provides outreach, engagement, and implementation activities to support TA in assigned states, tribes, and territories (STTs), including:
• *
assessing/developing an understanding of site child welfare systems
• conducting child welfare landscape analysis to align National Center work with the STT priorities
• initiating, compiling, and tracking strategic contacts for outreach.
• establishing and maintaining relationships primarily with child welfare and secondarily with mental health leaders and supporting cross-system collaboration/integration
• motivating buy-in to and understanding by system leaders and TA participants
• providing outreach and education; tracking outcomes of outreach activities
• contributing to the development of intensive TA plans and sustainability plans.
• executing assigned strategies within TA plan. -
• providing leadership and coordination for the National Center staff and consultants working with the CW-CIS to deliver TA to each site, including ensuring the team has the needed expertise, skills, and support to partner with the site and deliver effective TA.
• troubleshooting challenges with TA delivery, implementation, and integration
• working with sites to establish training and adoption competency requirements or policies, as needed, to support adoption competency implementation for child welfare and mental health service providers
• ensuring consistent on-the-ground TA support for sites supplemented with virtual support
• this position may assume the responsibility of being a site lead on a TA site and would carry the responsibility of orchestrating a TA team to develop a TA plan and effectively deliver
• Prioritizes incorporating lived expertise—from families and youth—in TA development and delivery
• Provides input, as needed, to inform the National Center’s TA model, TA delivery strategies, and approaches for evaluating TA effectiveness.
• Develops engagement, presentation, and dissemination of materials and informational products for outreach and promotion.
• Responds accurately and timely to inquiries from potential TA sites and clearly communicates information about the process for being considered as a TA site, the required levels of commitment and effort from a TA site, and how the National Center approaches partnering with TA sites.
• Provides timely tracking of all project activities for periodic reporting, quality assurance, and evaluation.
• Participate actively in National Center Team and related meetings (in person and virtual).
• Staff exhibits and presents about the National Center or other C.A.S.E.-related activities at assigned state, regional, and national meetings, conferences, and tradeshows.
• Documents all work done on in accordance with National Center standards.

OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Within 90 days of hire, completes NTI for Child Welfare. Gains working knowledge of Training for Adoption Competency (TAC) and other C.A.S.E. training offerings, including developing working knowledge of products, audiences, learning objectives, product benefits, and product relationships.
• Completes other professional training as assigned by the Director of Technical Assistance.
• Travel: must meet with and provide TA in person to sites/states assigned to the CW-IS, as needed.
• Participates in monthly C.A.S.E. staff meetings (in person or virtual) and other C.A.S.E.-related activities as assigned. Participates in National Center on-site team 1-day meetings as required 4-5 times a year.
• Performs other related duties as may be required.

SUPERVISION EXCERCISED: None

SUPERVISION RECEIVED: The Director of Technical Assistance supervises the position and will provide thought leadership and direction on project implementation. The individual will participate in at least monthly team meetings and individual supervision sessions (in person or virtual). The position is home-based. The position must be able to work effectively independently, setting meetings and work schedules that best meet the needs of the assigned TA sites.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below represent the minimum knowledge, skill, and ability required unless otherwise stated.

COMMENTS: Other relevant education and/or experience may be substituted for the stated minimum education and experience requirements.
